page.title: 14SALTWELL PARK:A PUPILS VIEW
page.content: by Rebecca McNichol, Class 4Y, {Low Fell Junior School,}Gateshead. Saltwell Park is near the centre of Gateshead. It is a funny shaped park with four main roads and lots of houses around. It has a lot of green grass and trees. It is a good pace for children. The facilities are good for little children. There are tennis courts, a little paddling pool and a playground with swings. In the "big park" concerts are held in the bandstands and children can enjoy horse rides. In the "little park" there are animal attractions. Both parts of the park contain beautiful flowers and interesting wildlife is to found among the plants and trees. A big attraction is the aeroplane fuselage. All in all I think its a great park.
